title: Shiloh Industries Names Scott Borovich Vice President Sales And Program Management
text:
Shiloh Industries, Inc.
PLYMOUTH, Mich. , Sept. 8, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Today, Shiloh Industries announced that Scott Borovich has been named vice president sales and program management at Shiloh Industries, Inc., a leading supplier of lightweighting, noise and vibration solutions. Borovich will be leading Shiloh's sales, business development and program management globally.
Borovich will be assuming Dave Jaeger's responsibilities as the sales leader. Jaeger will focus his efforts on leading Shiloh's CastLight™ brand which has received significant new business awards leading to the construction of aluminum casting operations in China , the expansion of magnesium operations in Poland and the launch of the company's aluminum and magnesium casting plant in Clarksville, Tenn. , USA.
"Scott's global experience will be critical as we expand to support our customers' needs," said Brad Tolley , senior vice president, business development and technology. "Along with his demonstrated success in customer relationship management, he brings the leadership in program management and flawless launch execution that our customers expect of Shiloh ."
In this role, Borovich will head all global sales and business development. He will also be responsible for global program management.
Borovich has an extensive background in business development and program management. He has 18 years of global automotive experience with Lear and Visteon Corporation. Most recently, Borovich was the vice president of sales and program management at exterior lighting supplier Varroc Lighting Systems.
Borovich attended Eli Broad College of Business at Michigan State University where he obtained his Bachelor of Arts degree in Business Administration.
About Shiloh Industries, Inc.
Headquartered in Valley City, Ohio , Shiloh Industries, Inc. is a leading global supplier of lightweighting, noise and vibration solutions to the automotive, commercial vehicle and industrial segments, capable of delivering solutions in aluminum, magnesium, steel and high-strength steel alloys to original equipment manufacturers and suppliers. The company offers the broadest portfolio of lightweighting solutions in the industry through their BlankLight ™, CastLight ™ and StampLight ™ brands. Shiloh designs and manufactures components in body, chassis and powertrain systems with expertise in precision blanks, ShilohCore ™ acoustic laminates, aluminum and steel laser welded blanks, complex stampings, modular assemblies, aluminum and magnesium die casting, as well as precision machined components. Shiloh has nearly 3,300 dedicated employees with operations, sales and technical centers throughout Asia , Europe and North America .
